heaviest_rainfall.status: On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 34.3mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: On 09 November 2025, the rain lasted for 144.8 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  47.89mm accumulated and it fell at 24.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 06 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 3 cold snaps; typically, 3.6 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 0 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (207°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: 128.2 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.7°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.0 mm).

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 88.8m higher than yesterday, 0.3m lower than the past week, 13.0m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 557m to 849m and averaged 760.4m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. Showers, the sky will be mostly cloudy (or even foggy) with low clouds, and the light is absent. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
